title: --eth1-endpoints fallback to the second endpoint even when the first is working fine
body:
## Description

I have been using the `--eth1-endpoints` with two clients from the very beginning, I mainly use geth local but I have infura as "backup" but recently I noticed that my infura endpoint is getting a lot of request, way more than the `100,000` in the free plan, but I believe this request should be only for my local geth and only go to infura if the first endpoint fails, am I right? apparently that is not what is happening. I remember this working fine at the beginning but I cant remember the version of lighthouse, I just noticed this problem recently.

## Version

```
root@validator_node:/# lighthouse --version
Lighthouse v1.3.0-3a24ca5
BLS Library: blst-portable
Specs: mainnet (true), minimal (false), v0.12.3 (false)
```

Please provide your Lighthouse and Rust version. Are you building from
`stable` or `unstable`, which commit?

stable

## Present Behaviour

lighthouse is using the two `eth1-endpoints` available even when the first one is available

Describe the present behaviour of the application, with regards to this
issue.

No major problems as far I can tell, but this behavior is not ideal since it uses all the free requests of infura even when the local geth is working fine

## Expected Behaviour

Using only the first endpoint if working

## Steps to resolve

`--eth1-endpoints http://geth:8545,https://mainnet.infura.io/v3/XXXXXX`

Are you getting any WARN logs similar to
`Error connecting to eth1 node endpoint, action: trying fallbacks`

Nope, looks all good... if I stop geth... yes I see `Error connecting to eth1 node endpoint, action: trying fallbacks` but only if I stop geth



```
root@mars:/home/ubuntu# docker logs beacon_node --follow --tail 10
Apr 28 14:47:35.423 INFO Attestation included in block           validator: 71854, slot: 1066435, epoch: 33326, inclusion_lag: 0 slot(s), index: 8, head: 0x95015b6b8f3df188ad2a3e496f6a5d52afb79ec9e606041601cc951072dbd49d, service: val_mon
Apr 28 14:47:41.003 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066436, block: 0x6737…ed57, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 54, service: slot_notifier
Apr 28 14:47:47.266 INFO New block received                      hash: 0x5003…9dff, slot: 1066437
Apr 28 14:47:53.001 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066437, block: 0x5003…9dff, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 55, service: slot_notifier
Apr 28 14:48:02.208 INFO New block received                      hash: 0xbf4a…beb9, slot: 1066438
Apr 28 14:48:05.000 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066438, block: 0xbf4a…beb9, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 53, service: slot_notifier
Apr 28 14:48:11.447 INFO New block received                      hash: 0x9229…5288, slot: 1066439
Apr 28 14:48:17.002 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066439, block: 0x9229…5288, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 55, service: slot_notifier

Apr 28 14:48:29.004 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066440, block: 0x1f85…e9de, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 55, service: slot_notifier
Apr 28 14:48:35.243 INFO New block received                      hash: 0x8ef5…e566, slot: 1066441
Apr 28 14:48:41.001 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066441, block: 0x8ef5…e566, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 54, service: slot_notifier

Apr 28 14:48:59.353 INFO New block received                      hash: 0x1fb4…492b, slot: 1066443
Apr 28 14:49:05.004 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066443, block: 0x1fb4…492b, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 53, service: slot_notifier
Apr 28 14:49:11.560 INFO New block received                      hash: 0xce00…6325, slot: 1066444

Apr 28 14:49:29.001 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066445, block: 0xbb08…bb80, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 55, service: slot_notifier

Apr 28 14:49:41.000 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1066446, block: 0xe8b8…04cb, epoch: 33326, finalized_epoch: 33324, finalized_root: 0x9c6a…be1d, peers: 55, service: slot_notifier
Apr 28 14:49:47.310 INFO New block received                      hash: 0xf048…72d4, slot: 1066447
```
I create a new API key with infura to make sure, nothing else is using it, I ll update here in a few hours

You can also enable debug logs on your geth with `--verbosity 4` option to check if it's receiving and responding to requests.
You will see logs like
```
DEBUG[04-28|20:50:11.902] Served net_version                       conn=127.0.0.1:53116 reqid=1 t="29.904_s"                            
DEBUG[04-28|20:50:11.908] Served eth_chainId                       conn=127.0.0.1:53118 reqid=1 t="32.564_s"                            
DEBUG[04-28|20:50:11.916] Served eth_getBlockByNumber    conn=127.0.0.1:53118 reqid=1 t="183.023_s"
```
ok, we can disregard this... apparently the infura API key was compromised and after revoking and create a new one I see no requests to infura anymore, so, lighthouse is working as expected.
